values.text: "Enhancement" is a change to the system that adds new functionality or changes old functionality.

To create a PO using "Copy From" Contract, the Contract must be created with the Process Option set to "PO."

To enable "Copy From" on a Contract not set to "PO" when created, cancel the Contract and create a new one with "PO" as the Process Option.

ERROR: "Invalid Project ID” indicates that the Project ID entered on the PO was invalid or inactive when the PO was created.

NOTE: This warning message can be ignored.

To edit a PO (value of account in distribution lines), clear the value in Alt Account and change the value in the Account field.

Refer to Knowledge Article KB0062071 in ServiceNow.

To create a PO (Encumbrance Only), to encumber funds for a non-procurement-related transactions, refer to Job Aid "Create an Encumbrance Only Purchase Order 7.0" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2338
email: "Exceeding the grace period” emails are sent when reconciled P-Card transactions are in "Verified" status and the transactions are not yet approved.
There is only one level of approval required for P-Card transactions since there is no approval workflow process setup for the P-Card transaction reconciliation process in FI\$Cal.

To view Sales/Use Tax on P-Card purchases:

Refer to FAQ \#19 "How do I track the sales/use tax on my purchases paid by P-Card?" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/P-Card_FAQs_1.0.docx

To view changes made to a Dispatched PO:

Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Manage Change Orders > Review Changes

NOTE: the Change Order from the Dispatched PO must be "Approved" for the changes to display.

To enable a Supplier to do business with FI\$Cal departments/agencies:

1. The Supplier mails or hand delivers a hard copy of new or updated "Payee Data Record" form (STD 204) to each department/agency with which they do business.
2. The department/agency reviews the form(s)
3. Approved forms are securely forwarded (not emailed) to the FI\$Cal Vendor Management Group (VMG).

NOTE: a current STD 204 must be on file at FI\$Cal before a PO, Contract, payment, or 1099 can be generated for a Supplier.
NOTE: a TIN is either a Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) or a Social Security Number (SSN).
NOTE: the name and Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) on the STD 204 will be validated with the federal Internal Revenue Service (IRS).
NOTE: if the IRS TIN validation process results in any discrepancies, FI\$Cal will contact the department/agency and the Supplier.

Refer to Job Aid "Adding a Supplier Record" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=1849

To Budget Check a PO (or multiple POs):

*the PO must be approved
*all required Chart Fields (Appropriation Reference, Fund, ENY, Account, Alt Account, Reporting Structure & Program), in each line of the PO must have a valid value
*Miscellaneous Charges should be set to "Prorated Freight"

NOTE: A PO may be Saved even when it cannot be Budget Checked successfully.

To Budget Check multiple POs, go to: Main Menu>Purchasing> Purchase Orders >Buyer's Workbench.
"Awaiting User Info" means that the analyst working on the ticket has sent a request for additional information, which is required to fulfill/solve the request in a timely manner.

"Financial Information Systems for California" (FI\$Cal)
For more information, training and other resources about FI\$Cal:

web: www.fiscal.ca.gov
Email: fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov
Phone:  855-347-2250

To copy a Requisition (all lines) to a PO, select "Max Rows" on the "Copy from Requisition" page.

NOTE: The default setting copies only 20 rows from the Requisition to the PO.

The Match rules do not apply to POs paid by P-Card, so the system will not require a Receipt ID to be created.

NOTE: Confirmation that the goods/services are received occurs during the P-Card reconciliation process.

To contact the FI\$Cal Service Center (FSC):

FAQs & Job Aids: https://fiscal.ca.gov/
Phone: 1-855-FISCAL0 (1-855-347-2250)
Email: fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov
Service Hours: 7:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Pacific Time), M-F (except on state holidays)

To resolve PO line unit price issue(s):

Refer to FAQ \#25 "Why does my PO ID have \$0.00 in the PO line unit price when I copied this PO from my procurement contract?" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/Purchase_Order_FAQs_1.0.docx

NOTE: The PO line unit price is not editable because the checkboxes for "Price can be changed on Orders" were not checked at the contract header and the contract line on the associated contract from which the PO ID was copied.
NOTE: If these checkboxes were checked on the contract, the user will be able to change the unit price only up to the amount entered on the contract line base price. They will not be able to change to more than that base price amount.
To view Receipt comments, select "Show at Receipt" at PO comments.
To purchase an Asset refer to Job Aid "Buyer's Guide to Fleet Asset Purchases" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=1888

"To identify a department super user, please call or email the Change Management Office at:

Email: fiscal.cmo\@fiscal.ca.gov
Client Communications: (916) 576-1250"

ERROR: ""Exceeds Budget Tolerance""

Contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.

"Department Authority/Designee" (DAD) is an individual authorized to request Roles, add/delete user accounts, and appoint/remove other DADs.

NOTE: Each Business Unit (BU) has a "Department Authority" and that person appoints "Department Designee(s)"" for that department."

To close a PO (and disencumber remaining funds):

Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Buyer’s Workbench
1. Enter Business Unit (BU), Workbench ID, click Add.
2. Enter PO ID, click Search.
3. Enter Description, select PO Number, click Close.
4. Click PO Number in Not Qualified column.
5. Click arrow icon (to push to Qualified column).
6. Click Yes.
7. Click Budget Check.
8. Click Yes.

Refer to Job Aid "Closing a Purchase Order (PO) to Release Encumbrance Balances" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2298

NOTE: POs can be closed even if a Receipt or Voucher has not been created.
NOTE: the encumbrance balance will be liquidated when the Budget Check is run on the closed PO.
NOTE: if the report ZZ_ENCUMBRANCE_STATUS_NEW shows the encumbered amount > expensed amount, the Sales/Use Tax, misc. charges, or freight, was probably encumbered on the PO but not paid on the Voucher.

To verify that PO(s) closed and disencumbered successfully:
Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Review PO Information > PO

To enable Chart Fields:

If your Chart Fields values did not default in your entry, or you have not been provided the Chart Fields values to use, consult with your supervisor, manager or departmental designated super user.
To assign a P-Card Approver (or multiple Approvers) to one cardholder, use the Assign Proxies page.
This is a warning message. You should be checking the budget header status, and if it says "Valid," then ignore the message.
To request access to the UNSPSC catalog, please contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.

To close multiple POs:

"select a range of POs and close them all together" ^ADJUST STEPS BELOW (1 PO) FOR MULTIPLE POS

Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Buyer’s Workbench
1. Enter Business Unit (BU), Workbench ID, click Add.
2. Enter PO ID, click Search.
3. Enter Description, select PO Number, click Close.
4. Click PO Number in Not Qualified column.
5. Click arrow icon (to push to Qualified column).
6. Click Yes.
7. Click Budget Check.
8. Click Yes.

Refer to Job Aid "Closing a Purchase Order (PO) to Release Encumbrance Balance 1.0."

NOTE: POs can be closed even if a Receipt or Voucher has not been created.
NOTE: the encumbrance balance will be liquidated when the Budget Check is run on the closed PO.
NOTE: if the report ZZ_ENCUMBRANCE_STATUS_NEW shows the encumbered amount > expensed amount, the Sales/Use Tax, misc. charges, or freight, was probably encumbered on the PO but not paid on the Voucher.

To verify that PO(s) closed and disencumbered successfully, navigate to:

Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Review PO Information > PO

Refer to Job Aid FI\$Cal.362 and Job Aid FI\$Cal.243 at: http://www.fiscal.ca.gov/access-fiscal/procurementjobaids.html

To view the Financials Worklist:

1. Navigate to http://www.fiscal.ca.gov.
2. Click on Access FI\$Cal.
3. Click on Access the FI\$Cal Application.
4. Click on Agree to terms and conditions.
5. Enter Username.
6. Enter Password.
7. Enter OTP code (if required for user ID).
*The Employee portal opens (https://portal.fiscal.ca.gov/psp/psppd1/EMPLOYEE/EMPL/h/?tab=ZZ_FISCAL)
8. Click on PeopleSoft link on Employee portal.
*The Financials portal opens (https://financials.fiscal.ca.gov/psp/psfpd1/EMPLOYEE/ERP/h/?tab=DEFAULT)
9. Click on Worklist link on Financials portal.

NOTE: An empty worklist may indicate you are viewing a "Portal worklist."

To receive Worklist Items:

Main Menu > My System Profile.
1. Select “Worklist User"" checkbox.
2. Click Save.

To request an enhancement to FI\$Cal, complete a Request For Change (RFC) form, then deliver the RFC to your Department Authority/Designee (DAD). The form and instructions for filling it out can be found at:
https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/RFCForm_v13.0.xlsm

To assign dual/conflicting roles to a single user, a Secondary ID is created.

EXAMPLE: Processor and Approver roles cannot be simultaneously assigned to a single user ID.
NOTE: Secondary IDs are identified at the department level via a unique email address.
NOTE: To request a Secondary ID the Departmental Authority/Designee (DAD) submits a Multi-User Access Request Form (MARF) to the FI\$Cal Service Center.

See Access FAQs at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/User_Access_Request_FAQs_Feb_2016.pdf
To refresh PO encumbrance balance after editing a PO, Save and Budget Check the PO.

To check if a Voucher has been created from a PO, refer to the Document Status link and the Activity Summary links visible on the Add/Update PO page.

NOTE: Information related to Vouchers, Receipts Created, Payments, and Matching will also be available via these links.

To resolve a ticket the FI\$Cal Service Center (FSC) will need:

*a detailed explanation of the issue
*steps required to recreate the issue
*relevant screenshots (including navigation or breadcrumbs) to allow the FSC to see exactly where you were in the system and what you were doing when the issue occurred
*Business Unit (BU) ID
*identifying information (e.g., Voucher ID, PO ID, transaction number, User ID , etc.)
To view Job Aids: https://fiscal.ca.gov/user-support/job-aids/
When an LPA Contract has been selected on the PO, the Acquisition Type defaults to the Acquisition Type specified on the LPA contract.

To dispatch a PO or re-print a Dispatched PO, the PO must be "Approved" and have a ""Valid"" Budget Check status.

Refer to Procurement FAQ, \#2,"How do I Dispatch/print the original PO to send to the vendor?" ^LINK

NOTE: occasionally, a temporary server issue may slow the dispatch process. If this occurs, try waiting a few minutes and then dispatch the PO again.

To add Freight Charges to an encumbered PO requires a Change Order, re-approval, and Budget Check (to encumber the additional funds).

NOTE: The system will also allow adding and paying freight charge on the Voucher, but this will create a negative balance on the Encumbrance Status report (ZZ_ENCUMBRANCE_STATUS_NEW).

To attach an invoice or receipt to a P-Card statement:

See P-Card FAQ \#42 "SCO Audit denied my P-Card voucher ID because the incorrect invoice/receipt had been attached. How do I correct this?" at:
http://www.fiscal.ca.gov/faqs/HowToFAQs.html

To attach a document to P-Card transactions:

Refer to P-Card FAQ \#35 at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/P-Card_FAQs_1.0.docx

To view SCPRS upload errors:

Main Menu > Sourcing > Fiscal SCPRS > SCPRS Upload History

To edit a PO (line item amount), on a PO created from a Contract:

1. Open the PO.
2. Navigate to the Price Adjustment tab.
3. Change Adjustment amount to your desired amount and click OK.
4. Click on the Save button.
5. Budget Check the PO.

To enable email notifications:

Main Menu > My System Profile

Verify that Email User and Worklist User are checked.

To edit PO terms and conditions on Purchase Orders, e.g., Buyers/PO Processors see FAQ \#1 in Procurement FAQs at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/Purchase_Order_FAQs_1.0.docx

To print a PO ("official" version), Dispatch the PO.

NOTE: an un-dispatched/unofficial/draft version of a PO may be printed (auto-labeled "Draft").
To correct issues with roles, contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.
US Bank sends the P-Card transaction statements with the level of detail the merchants send them.

Disallowed: consolidation of multiple Requisitions into a single PO.

Refer to FAQ \#38 - "I copied my Requisition into a PO in error. Could I source/copy my Requisition into a new PO?" at: http://fiscal.ca.gov/faqs/documents/RequisitionFAQs1.0.docx"

To create a PO Receipt:

1. PO status must be "Dispatched."
2. Budget Check status must be "Valid."
3. The quantity/amount to be received from the PO must be greater than zero.
This is a warning message. You are unable to change the adjustment. Ignore the warning message and continue with your transaction.
To edit a PO (freight charges), refer to ServiceNow Knowledge Article KB0062072.

The warning: "Receiving Required" or "Receipt is Required" on a Voucher means the PO Receiving option was set to "Required."

NOTE: Create the Receipt by copying the PO, attaching the Receipt in the Voucher, then restarting the matching process.
"Exemption Code" is not a required field and may be left blank on a PO.

To view Event Approver(s):

Main Menu > Sourcing > Maintain Events > Event Workbench
1. Enter Business Unit (BU) and Event ID.
2. click Search.
3a. (scroll to right) select "Approval Status" OR
3b. (scroll down) select "View Approvals"

NOTE: To re-trigger the approval process, submit a new version of the Event.

To edit a PO (Supplier address):

1. Open the PO in the Add/Update POs page.
2. Create a new PO.
3. Select the desired Supplier ID.
4. Click on the Supplier Details link.
5. Select the desired address code in the prompt for "Address" (address on the original PO will be updated)
To view reports for Requisition, Purchase Orders, P-Card, Receipts, Sourcing, and Procurement contracts: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=3337

To create a PDF file of a PO with the validated departmental logo and signature, the PO Process Instance must be accessed from when the PO was originally dispatched.

NOTE: View Printable Version is for reference purposes only; to show PO details, will display the PO as "Draft" and no signature will appear.
ERROR: “Budget not established” should be reported to the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.
To remove a user's access to FI\$Cal, submit the respective access form and transfer all active transactions (e.g., POs associated with the user/Buyer) to another departmental user.
To resolve a Data Integrity Error, contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.
To classify an Asset refer to Job Aid "Correctly Classifying Items As Assets in FI\$Cal" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=1077

To request a WebEx Session with a technician:

(1) a ticket must be generated.
(2) the Service Technician must contact you.

"To request information about future FI\$Cal forums, call or email the FI\$Cal Change Management Office (CMO) at:

Email: fiscal.cmo\@fiscal.ca.gov
Client Communications: (916) 576-1250

NOTE: Information about previous forums can be found at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/events/"

To create a Contract (new version), refer to ServiceNow Knowledge Article KB0062069.

NOTE: Once approved, open the PO and set the contract version to the most recently approved version, and Save the PO.
To create a Buyer contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.
To enable Contract attachments and comments to automatically flow to a PO, select "Copy to PO" on the Contract.
To request a change, an SFTP request form must be submited by the Departmental Authority/Designee (DAD) requesting the change.

To edit a PO (Chart Fields) with encumbrance remaining:

NOTE: For PO payments already made, Chart Fields cannot be modified.

OPTION 1
1. Create a new PO.
2. Assign the desired Chart Fields to the remaining encumbrance.
3. Close the original PO to release the encumbrance. 

OPTION 2
1. Add a line to the original PO.
2. Assign the desired Chart Fields to the remaining encumbrance.
To edit a Supplier refer to Job Aid "Completing the Supplier Update Request Form" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=1730

To approve a CSCR Event, see: http://www.fiscal.ca.gov/upk/PO383_v2.1.0/html/tpc/a6a0f490-33ad-4e32-8d8e-6cba628cb01f/topic.html

To view CSCR Event approval details:

Main Menu > Sourcing > Maintain Events > Event Workbench
1. click Inquiry.

NOTE: the Inquiry hyperlink only appears if Event status is “Pending Approval."

To create a PO from a Requisition and have the P-Card automatically flow to the PO, the same P-Card holder must create the Requisition, then use ""Copy from Requisition"" to create the PO.

Refer to FAQ \#30 - "Will the P-Card info flow to the PO?" at: http://fiscal.ca.gov/faqs/documents/RequisitionFAQs1.0.docx
To view the approval worklist, click on the link "Worklist" (top-right corner of screen).

To close a Contract (all versions of), close the final version (only).

To resolve browser issues (choose one):

INTERNET EXPLORER: press Alt+X to open your browser’s settings. Select Internet Options. Under Browsing History, click on “Delete" and check “Cookies and Website Data.” Finally, click on Delete.
GOOGLE CHROME: Press Ctrl+Shift+Delete on your keyboard. Check “Cookies and other site data” as well as “Cached images and files.” Finally, click Clear Data. 
MOZILLA FIREFOX: Press Ctrl+Shift+Delete on your keyboard. Select time range. Check Cookies and Cache. Finally, click Clear Now.

Additional information at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/Browser_Delete_Cache_Help_Guide.pdf

The receiving tolerance is not a configuration item so a Department PO Buyer can decide at the PO ID level whether or not to check the checkbox for the ‘Reject Qty Over Tolerance field.’ If the ‘Reject Qty Over Tolerance’ field is checked, then the system will only allow the user to receive the quantity ordered. However, if the Reject Qty Over Tolerance field is NOT checked, then the system will allow the Department PO Receiving Processor to create multiple Receipt IDs against the quantity ordered or the service amount. The system is designed to leave this checkbox unchecked.

NOTE: If the additional Receipt IDs were copied to Voucher IDs by mistake, the new Voucher IDs will fail matching because the total quantity and/or amount received have already been matched to the first associated Receipt ID and PO ID. Recommend removing until the resolution can be verified and simplified.

To resolve P-Card transactions (offset associated/disputed) into one Voucher ID, the department P-Card Reconciler and/or actual Cardholder must reconcile and get approval for both transactions - on the same day.

NOTE: If there is any difference between the total disputed charge and credit amount, only the difference will be paid to US Bank.
NOTE: NEVER reconcile the disputed and credit transactions separately - this can potentially create a zero or negative amount Voucher. This zero or negative amount Voucher ID will not be picked up by the SCO Pay Cycle and will require additional work from the Accounting staff.

Refer to FAQ\# 47 "I received my credit for the disputed P-Card transaction. What is my next step?" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/Purchase_Order_FAQs_1.0.docx

There is a maximum amount on the contract header. A PO cannot be created for more than the maximum amount of the contract. If a PO of maximum amount has already been created from a contract, then the contract would not be available to be copied into another PO. In this case, create a new version of the contract to increase its max amount:

1. Navigate to Main Menu > Procurement contracts > LPA/Departmental Contract Search.
2. Open the Contract in edit mode.
3. Click on New Version.
4. Increase the maximum amount and make any other changes as per your requirement.
5. Save and submit the contract for approval. Once the Contract is approved it will be available to be copied in a PO.

To copy a Requisition to a PO, the Requisition:

*cannot be in "Canceled", "Closed" or "Open" status.
*must be approved and Budget Checked.
*"Document Status" must indicate that no other PO has been created from the Requisition.
*encumbrance balance must be zero.

NOTE: A non-zero balance indicates that the Requisition is already linked to a PO and assignment to multiple POs is not allowed.
NOTE: a Requisition line can only be used to create a PO once; additional Requisition lines are employed to create additional POs, such as to different Suppliers.

Sales/Use Tax is calculated on the P-Card Reconciliation page, as follows:

*if the P-Card transaction is linked to a PO ID, then the Sales/Use Tax info from the PO line will carry over to the P-Card transaction. 
*if the PO ID has multiple PO lines, then the system will automatically split the summary P-Card transaction into the corresponding PO lines, and Sales/Use Tax will carry over to the newly split P-Card transaction lines.
*if there is no PO ID, then department P-Card Reconciler must manually split the summary P-Card transaction into multiple lines. The Reconciler will need to include the unit cost of each line plus the Sales/Use Tax, and enter that amount on each split line. The total split amount must equal 100% of the summary total amount which is the original amount that came from US Bank.

NOTE: Sales/Use Tax that carried over from the PO ID or was manually calculated on P-Card transactions will not flow to the P-Card Voucher ID. All system-generated P-Card Voucher IDs are created as Tax Exempt.

To create a PO discounted amount with the Sales/Use Tax calculated on the original amount, follow these steps:

1. Create a PO with two PO lines.
2. In the first line put the original amount of the item and apply Sales/Use Tax on it. The system will calculate the Sales/Use Tax on the original item.
3. In the second line provide the discount given by the Supplier as a negative amount and make this line as "Item Exempt."

EXAMPLE: Your item's cost is \$100 and the Sales/Use Tax is 8.75%. The Supplier has provided you with a discount of \$20. Create a PO with two PO lines. Enter the first line as \$100 and the system will calculate the appropriate 8.75% Sales/Use Tax. In the second line put the amount as \$-20, and check line 2 as "Item exempt" (making line 2 non-taxable). The PO calculates Sales/Use Tax amount of \$8.75 and the merchandise amount \$80.

Sales/Use Tax:

*that is calculated by a Supplier must match the Sales/Use Tax on the FI\$Cal PO. NOTE: If the values do not match, the Supplier must correct their calculation. This cannot be changed on the PO side.
*is calculated when a FI\$Cal PO is created.
*is calculated at PO line level (not at PO header level) so varying tax rates can be applied to each line and/or item.
*may not be added to a Requisition.
*may encumber a Requisition only if there are sufficient funds to cover both the Requisition and tax amounts.

After paying for a P-Card transaction using the ORF paper claim process, the:

Department P-Card Reconciler or cardholder will -
1. follow the P-Card reconciliation process, per Job Aid ""P-Card Transaction Reconciliation Process in FI\$Cal"" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2182

FI\$Cal system will -
2. apply the prepaid payment from the ORF against a system-generated P-Card Voucher and pay US Bank the difference (if the other P-Card transactions were on the same Voucher).

NOTE: If there is a credit (negative) Voucher line on the system-generated P-Card Voucher, FI\$Cal will not replenish the outstanding prepaid ORF Voucher. FI\$Cal will only apply the prepaid payment when there is no credit (negative) Voucher line.

Main Menu > eProcurement > Manage Requisitions
1. Enter Business Unit and Requisition ID and click on Search.
2. Select Requisition ID.
3. Scroll to the right and select the action "Check Budget" from the drop-down menu and click on the Go button.
4. Verify whether the Budget Check status is Valid.

NOTE: to Budget Check a Requisition in "Open" or "Denied" status, first re-submit the Requisition for approval.
